ä»¥ä¸‹ã¯reST 0.4ã®Changelogã€‚

Release 0.4 (2002-04-18)
========================

This is the final release of reStructuredText as an independent
package.  Development is being transferred to the Docutils_ project
immediately.
  • å…ƒã€…å˜ç‹¬ãƒ—ãƒ­ã‚¸ã‚§ã‚¯ãƒˆã ã£ãŸã‚‚ã®ãŒDocutilsã®v0.1ã§Docstringã¨çµ±åˆã•ã‚Œã¦ã„ã‚‹(2002/04/20)

merged from the now inactive reStructuredText and Docstring Processing System projects

  • reStructuredTextè·¡ã¨ã€æ—§ãƒšãƒ¼ã‚¸

Date: 2002-04-21

The reStructuredText project has moved! It is now part of the Docutils project; you should be redirected to the new location momentarily. Click here to go to the Docutils project home page immediately. You may also visit the inactive reStructuredText home page.

  • Docstring Processing Systemè·¡ã¨ã€æ—§ãƒšãƒ¼ã‚¸

Date: 2002-04-21

The Docstring Processing System project has moved and been renamed! It is now called â€œDocutilsâ€; you should be redirected to the new location momentarily. Click here to go to the Docutils project home page immediately. You may also visit the inactive Docstring Processing System home page.

  • setext Documents Mirrorè·¡

Here are local copies of some setext documents, made available to document the prehistory of the Docutils project (and especially the reStructuredText markup). The source for the original setext (structure-enhanced text) documents was http://www.bsdi.com/setext/, but it seems to have disappeared from the Web. The files in the â€œsetext mirrorâ€ are all the files relating to setext that I have (including a tarball of the lot). I have not been able to locate the originators of setext, Ian Feldman or Tony Sanders. If you know how to contact them, or if you know of an official repository for the setext documents, please inform me. David Goodger, 2002-03-25

ä»¥ä¸‹ã®ãƒ‘ãƒƒãƒã‚’ã‚ã¦ã‚‹ or è©²å½“ãƒ•ã‚¡ã‚¤ãƒ«ã‚’å¤‰æ›´ã™ã‚‹ã€‚

ã“ã®ãƒ‘ãƒƒãƒã¯å–ã‚Šè¾¼ã¾ã‚Œã¦ã„ã¦ã€æœ€æ–°ç‰ˆã ã¨ãªãŠã£ã¦ã‚‹ã®ã‹ãªï¼Ÿ

â†’ 2.0.0 ã§ã¯ãªãŠã£ã¦ãŸï¼

  • ruby/lib/webrick/httpresponse.rb at ruby-2-0-0 Â· ruby/ruby Â· GitHub

ã¡ãªã¿ã«ã€ Railsã®issue ã‚’è¦‹ã‚‹ã¨ã€ã¿ã‚“ãªç™ºç”Ÿã—ã¦ãŸæ§˜å­ã€‚

RFCã«ã¯ã“ã†æ›¸ã„ã¦ã‚ã‚‹æ¨¡æ§˜ã€‚

  • Bug #5737: WEBrick doesnâ€™t support keep alive connections for 204 and 304 responses - ruby-trunk - Ruby Issue Tracking System

So if you want to do keep-alive, even if you add a content length, you will always get a warning. RFC2616 Section 4.4 says:

1.Any response message which â€œMUST NOTâ€ include a message-body (such as the 1xx, 204, and 304 responses and any response to a HEAD request) is always terminated by the first empty line after the header fields, regardless of the entity-header fields present in the message

I think this means that clients will know the length of the body, and clients can support keep-alive connections with no content-length for these types of responses.

     def read_directories(dir = '')
       base = File.join(self.source, dir)
       entries = Dir.chdir(base) { filter_entries(Dir['*']) }
       self.read_posts(dir)

       entries.each do |f|
         f_abs = File.join(base, f)
         f_rel = File.join(dir, f)
         if File.directory?(f_abs)
           next if self.dest.sub(/\/$/, '') == f_abs
           read_directories(f_rel)
         elsif !File.symlink?(f_abs)
           first3 = File.open(f_abs) { |fd| fd.read(3) }
           if first3 == "---"
#ï¼¼yamlï¼ï¼
             # file appears to have a YAML header so process it as a page
             pages << Page.new(self, self.source, dir, f)
           else
             # otherwise treat it as a static file
             static_files << StaticFile.new(self, self.source, dir, f)
           end
         end
       end
     end

Installing custom plugins

To install a plugin, put a ruby script to /etc/fluent/plugin directory.

Or you can create gem package that includes lib/fluent/plugin/_.rb file.

TYPE is in for input plugins, out for output plugins and buf for buffer plugins.

Itâ€™s like lib/fluent/plugin/out_mail.rb.

The packaged gem can be distributed and installed using RubyGems.

See Searching plugins.

http://fluentd.org/doc/devel.html

class FluPluGem < Fluent::Input
  Fluent::Plugin.register_input("inputs", self)
  def initialize
    super
  end

  def configure(conf)
    super
  end

  def start
    puts "a starts"
    @thread = Thread.new(&method(:run))
  end

  def run
    loop do
      Fluent::Engine.emit("debugx.debug", Fluent::Engine.now, {"plugin" => "yes"})
      sleep(2)
    end
  end
end

ã‚ˆãã‚ã‹ã‚‰ãªã„ã®ã§æœ¬ä¸¸ã‚’æ”»ã‚ã¦ã¿ã‚‹ã€‚pluginã®å‡¦ç†ã‚’è¨˜è¿°ã—ã¦ã„ã‚‹ã®ã¯ãã®ã‚‚ã®plugin.rbã€ã¾ãŸã€ãã‚Œã‚’å‘¼ã¼ã†ã¨ã—ã¦ã„ã‚‹ã¯supervisor.rb,engine.rbã‚ãŸã‚Šã£ã½ã„ã€‚

  • fluentd/lib/fluent/plugin.rb at master Â· fluent/fluentd Â· GitHub
  • fluentd/lib/fluent/engine.rb at master Â· fluent/fluentd Â· GitHub

ãƒ­ãƒ¼ãƒ‰ã—ã¦ã„ã‚‹ã®ã¯pluginå†…ã ã‚ã†ã¨æ€ã„ã€ã„ã‚ã„ã‚å‡ºåŠ›ã—ã¦ã¿ã‚‹ã€‚

  def load_plugins
    dir = File.join(File.dirname(__FILE__), "plugin")
puts "!load_plugins:#{dir}"
    load_plugin_dir(dir)
    load_gem_plugins
  end
  def load_plugin_dir(dir)
    dir = File.expand_path(dir)
puts "!load_plugin_dir:#{dir}"
    Dir.entries(dir).sort.each {|fname|
puts "!load_plugin_dir:#{fname}"
      if fname =~ /\.rb$/
        require File.join(dir, fname)
      end
    }
    nil
  end
  private
  def load_gem_plugins
    return unless defined? Gem
    plugins = Gem.find_files('fluent_plugin')
puts "!load_gem_plugins:#{plugins}"
    plugins.each {|plugin|
      begin
        load plugin
      rescue ::Exception => e
        msg = "#{plugin.inspect}: #{e.message} (#{e.class})"
        $log.warn "Error loading Fluent plugin #{msg}"
      end
    }
  end
  def try_load_plugin(name, type)
puts "!try_load_plugin:#{name}, #{type}"
    case name
    when 'input'
      path = "fluent/plugin/in_#{type}"
    when 'output'
      path = "fluent/plugin/out_#{type}"
    when 'buffer'
      path = "fluent/plugin/buf_#{type}"
    else
      return
    end

    # prefer LOAD_PATH than gems
    files = $LOAD_PATH.map {|lp|
puts "!try_load_plugin:#{lp}"
      lpath = File.join(lp, "#{path}.rb")
      File.exist?(lpath) ? lpath : nil
    }.compact
    unless files.empty?
      # prefer newer version
      require files.sort.last
      return
    end

    # search gems
    if defined?(::Gem::Specification) && ::Gem::Specification.respond_to?(:find_all)
      specs = Gem::Specification.find_all {|spec|
        spec.contains_requirable_file? path
      }

      # prefer newer version
      specs = specs.sort_by {|spec| spec.version }
      if spec = specs.last
        spec.require_paths.each {|lib|
          file = "#{spec.full_gem_path}/#{lib}/#{path}"
          require file
        }
      end

    # prefer LOAD_PATH than gems
    files = $LOAD_PATH.map {|lp|
puts "!try_load_plugin:#{lp}"
      lpath = File.join(lp, "#{path}.rb")
      File.exist?(lpath) ? lpath : nil
    }.compact
    unless files.empty?
      # prefer newer version
      require files.sort.last
      return
    end

    # search gems
    if defined?(::Gem::Specification) && ::Gem::Specification.respond_to?(:find_all)
      specs = Gem::Specification.find_all {|spec|
        spec.contains_requirable_file? path
      }

      # prefer newer version
      specs = specs.sort_by {|spec| spec.version }
      if spec = specs.last
        spec.require_paths.each {|lib|
          file = "#{spec.full_gem_path}/#{lib}/#{path}"
          require file
        }
      end

å‰å›ã¾ã§ã®ã‚ã‚‰ã™ã˜

å‚è€ƒã‚µã‚¤ãƒˆ

class SimpleInput < Fluent::Input

  Fluent::Plugin.register_input("simple_in", self)

  def start

  def run
    loop do
      # emitãƒ¡ã‚½ãƒƒãƒ‰ã®ç¬¬ä¸€å¼•æ•°ãŒ <match **.**> ã®**ã«è©²å½“ã™ã‚Œã°ãã®å½¢å¼ã§å‡ºåŠ›ã•ã‚Œã‚‹

      # fluent.confã«<match simple.output> type simple_outã‚’å®šç¾©ã—ãŸã®ã§ã€ä»¥ä¸‹ã®Outputå½¢å¼ã§å‡ºåŠ›ã•ã‚Œã‚‹
      Fluent::Engine.emit("simple.output", Fluent::Engine.now, {"simple" => "simout"})

end

ä¸Šã®ã‚½ãƒ¼ã‚¹ã«ã¯æ›¸ã‹ã‚Œã¦ã„ãªã„ã‘ã©ã€ä»–ã«ã‚‚ãƒ¡ã‚½ãƒƒãƒ‰ãŒã„ãã¤ã‹ã€‚(å…¬å¼ã‚µã‚¤ãƒˆã‚ˆã‚Š)

class SimpleOutput < Fluent::Output
  # ç¬¬ä¸€å¼•æ•°ãŒãƒ—ãƒ©ã‚°ã‚¤ãƒ³ã®åå‰ã€<match> ã® typeã«æŒ‡å®šã•ã‚Œã‚‹

  def emit(tag, es, chain)

end

å…¨ç„¶é–¢ä¿‚ãªã„ã‘ã©ã€Documentationã®ãƒšãƒ¼ã‚¸å†…ã«ã‚ã‚‹i.e.ã£ã¦å˜èªã‚’åˆã‚ã¦è¦‹ãŸã®ã§ã‚°ã‚°ã£ã¦ã¿ãŸã€‚è«–æ–‡ä¸­ã®ã€Œe.g.ã€ã€Œi.e.ã€ã®æ„å‘³ã¯ä½•ï¼Ÿ ï¼ Diary@ä¸€è‰²æ”¿å½¦WebSite that is ... ã™ãªã‚ã¡ã¨ã‹ãã†ã„ã†æ„å‘³ã‚‰ã—ã„ã€‚e.g.ã§ä¾‹ãˆã°ã€for exampleçš„ãªã€‚

require 'openssl'
require 'uri'
require 'net/http'

url = 'http://www.slideshare.net/api/2/get_slideshow'
param = Hash.new
param["slideshow_url"] = 'http://www.slideshare.net/gishi/wicket-presentation'
param["api_key"] = 'XXXXXXXX'
param["sharedsecret"] = 'XXXXXXXX'
# ts
param["ts"] = Time.now.to_i.to_s
# hash
param["hash"] = Digest::SHA1.hexdigest(param["sharedsecret"]+param["ts"])

uri = URI.parse(url)
Net::HTTP.new(uri.host).start do |http|
#Net::HTTP.new(uri.host, 80, ENV["PROXY"], 8080).start do |http|
  uri_param = param.sort.map {|i|i.join('=')}.join('&')
  
  res = http.get(uri.path + '?' + uri_param)
  puts res.body
end

  def auth(userStore)
    # ãƒãƒ¼ã‚¸ãƒ§ãƒ³ãƒã‚§ãƒƒã‚¯
    versionOK = userStore.checkVersion("MyEvernote",
      Evernote::EDAM::UserStore::EDAM_VERSION_MAJOR,
      Evernote::EDAM::UserStore::EDAM_VERSION_MINOR)
#      puts "Is my EDAM protocol version up to date? #{versionOK}"
    if (!versionOK) then
      exit(1)
    end
    begin
      auth = userStore.authenticate(
        @core["userName"],
        @core["password"],
        @core["consumerKey"],
        @core["consumerSecret"])
#        puts "Auth Success: #{auth.user.username}"
      return auth
    rescue Evernote::EDAM::Error::EDAMUserException => ex
      parameter = ex.parameter
      errorCode = ex.errorCode
      errorText = Evernote::EDAM::Error::EDAMErrorCode::VALUE_MAP[errorCode]
      puts "Auth Error: #{errorText}(ErrorCode: #{errorCode}), Parameter: #{parameter}"
      exit
    end
  end

EDAM(Evernote Data Access and Management)

  • Evernote Synchronization via EDAMã‚’èª­ã¿ã¾ã—ãŸ - soutaroã«ã£ã

UserStoreã¨ã¯

The UserStore service is primarily used by EDAM clients to establish authentication via username and password over a trusted connection (e.g. SSL). A client's first call to this interface should be checkVersion() to ensure that the client's software is up to date.

ãƒ¦ãƒ¼ã‚¶åã‚„ãƒ‘ã‚¹ãƒ¯ãƒ¼ãƒ‰ã‚’ä¿¡é ¼ã•ã‚ŒãŸæ¥ç¶šä¸Šã§èªè¨¼ã™ã‚‹ãŸã‚EDAMã‚¯ãƒ©ã‚¤ã‚¢ãƒ³ãƒˆã§åˆ©ç”¨ã•ã‚Œã‚‹ã€‚ã¯ã˜ã‚ã«checkVersion()ãƒ¡ã‚½ãƒƒãƒ‰ã‚’å‘¼ã³ã€ã‚¯ãƒ©ã‚¤ã‚¢ãƒ³ãƒˆã®ã‚½ãƒ•ãƒˆã®ãƒãƒ¼ã‚¸ãƒ§ãƒ³ãŒæœ€æ–°ã§ã‚ã‚‹äº‹ã‚’ä¿éšœã™ã¹ãã€‚

NoteStoreã¨ã¯

The NoteStore service is used by EDAM clients to exchange information about the collection of notes in an account. This is primarily used for synchronization, but could also be used by a "thin" client without a full local cache.

All functions take an "authenticationToken" parameter, which is the value returned by the UserStore which permits access to the account. This parameter is mandatory for all functions.

  • Solaris10 OSÂƒCÂƒÂ“ÂƒXÂƒgÂ[ÂƒÂ‹ÂŠÂ®Â—Â¹ÂŒÃ£Â‚ÃŒÂŠeÂÃ­ÂÃÂ’Ã¨2 (inetadm svcadm)
  • SMF ã§ã‚µãƒ¼ãƒ“ã‚¹ã®ãƒ¡ãƒ³ãƒ†ãƒŠãƒ³ã‚¹
  • svnserve ãƒ™ãƒ¼ã‚¹ã®ã‚µãƒ¼ãƒ
  • svnserve

*1: Neon is an HTTP and WebDAV client library - installs in /usr/local. Neon is used by subversion. There are slightly newer versions of neon, but this one seems to work best with subversion. Dependencies: openssl-1.0.0d, expat-2.0.1, zlib-1.2.5, and you will need /usr/local/lib/libgcc_s.so.1 either from the libgcc-3.4.6 or gcc-3.4.6 packages.

*2: SWIG is a software development tool that connects programs written in C and C++ with a variety of high-level programming languages. SWIG is used with different types of languages including common scripting languages such as Perl, PHP, Python, Tcl, Ruby and PHP - installs in /usr/local. Dependencies: zlib and having libgcc_s.so.1 and libstdc++.so.6 in /usr/local/lib is required. This can be done by installing libgcc-3.4.6 or gcc-3.4.6.

*3: Expat is a fast, non-validating, stream-oriented XML parsing library - installs in /usr/local. Dependency: to have /usr/local/lib/libgcc_s.so.1 install either the libgcc-3.4.6 or gcc-3.4.6 or later.

*4: Libxml2 is the XML C library developed for the Gnome project - installs in /usr/local. libxml2 requires that the zlib, libiconv, and either libgcc-3.4.6 or gcc-3.4.6 packages be installed.

*5: db is the Berkeley open source embedded database system - installs in /usr/local/BerkeleyDB.4.2. This packages also requires that you have install either libgcc or gcc.

*6: Openssl is an open source toolkit implementing the Secure Sockets Layer (SSL v2/v3) and Transport Layer Security (TLS v1) protocols as well as a full-strength general purpose cryptography library - installs in /usr/local/ssl. Note to users with sun4m machines. The openssl package here was built on a sun4u system and will not work on your machines. The one built for Solaris 2.5 was built on a sun4m machine and has been tested and does work. If you do uname -a and you get sun4m in the result, install the Solaris 2.5 openssl package instead. The configure option used for making openssl was solaris-sparcv9-gcc shared. You may also need to install either gcc-3.4.6 or libgcc-3.4.6 to obtain the libgcc_s.so.1 library. The libraries for openssl-0.9.8r are also included in this package to maintain compatibility for those packages still using them. If you cannot or do not want to update to the 1.0.x level, the 0.9.8p package below can be used. Openssl is often used to make machines more secure. Make sure you know what you are doing. Any security problems are your responsiblitiy. See our Disclaimer.

*7: GNU libiconv provides an iconv() implementation for use on systems which do not have one - installs in /usr/local. Dependencies: libgcc_s.so.1 from libgcc-3.4.6 or gcc-3.4.6 or higher.

*8: Libintl is used with gettext and is needed by a few programs when libintl in not in /usr/lib - installs in /usr/local/lib. Dependencies: libiconv and to have /usr/local/lib/libgcc_s.so.1 and /usr/local/lib/libstdc++.so.6, either the libgcc-3.4.6 or gcc-3.4.6 packages.

*9: This is the Cyrus SASL (Simple Authentication and Security Layer) API implementation. It can be used on the client or server side to provide authentication and authorization services - installs in /usr/local. Dependencies: db-4.2.52.NC and having libgcc_s.so.1 in /usr/local/lib is required. This can be done by installing libgcc-3.3 or gcc-3.3.2 or higher. The installation of the sasl software indicates:

*10: The GNU C compiler and related programs - installs in /usr/local. This package includes the GNU C, C++, and f77 suites and support files. These gcc packages require the installation of libiconv. It was compiled to use the SUN assembler and loader usually in /usr/ccs/bin if the SUNW developer packages are installed. When needed and the source code supports it, this C compiler can create 64-bit executables via the -m64 flag as well as the usual 32-bit ones. Please read the details on how this package was created which can be found at Comments on gcc 3.4.6 . The Details link below contains information on what is new in 3.4.6. Documentation is in /usr/local/doc/gcc, /usr/local/man, and /usr/local/info. The gcc package is quite large. Some users may have trouble downloading very large files via a browser. These users should try using command line anonymous ftp or perhaps the Sun Download Manager.

*11: zlib compression libraries - installs in /usr/local. This package has both libz.a and libz.so libraries. The package requires that libgcc_s.so.1 be in /usr/local/lib. This can be done by installing libgcc-3.3 or gcc or higher.

    puts "-z is #{v}"
  end
  # usage sort
  opt.on_tail('-y', 'MOVE TAIL!!') do |v|
    puts "v class is #{v.class}"
    puts "-y is #{v}"
  end

parseMsg(PATH)ãƒ¡ã‚½ãƒƒãƒ‰ã‚’ä½¿ç”¨ã—.msgãƒ•ã‚¡ã‚¤ãƒ«ã‚’èª­ã¿è¾¼ã‚ã‚‹ã‚ˆã†ã«ã€‚æœ€å¾Œã¯.msgãƒ•ã‚¡ã‚¤ãƒ«å†…ã‹ã‚‰æ·»ä»˜ãƒ•ã‚¡ã‚¤ãƒ«ã‚’ã¶ã£ã“ã¬ãï¼

    def getAttachmentSize()
        @msg.getAttachments.size
    end
    
    # æ·»ä»˜ãƒ•ã‚¡ã‚¤ãƒ«ã‚’pathã«ä¿å­˜ã™ã‚‹
    # è¿”ã‚Šå€¤ã¯ä¿å­˜ã—ãŸæ·»ä»˜ãƒ•ã‚¡ã‚¤ãƒ«å(ã®ä¸€ã¤)
    def saveFile(path)
        fileName = ""
        if getAttachmentSize() != 0 then
            for i in 0..getAttachmentSize - 1
                file = @msg.getAttachments.get(i)
                begin
                    fileName = file.getLongFilename
                rescue => ex
                    puts "File name is including WAVE DASH?:#{ex}"
                    fileName = file.getFilename
                end
                out = @fileOutputStream.new(path + fileName)
                out.write(file.getData)
                puts "â– .msgãƒ•ã‚¡ã‚¤ãƒ«æŠ½å‡º:#{fileName}"
                out.close
            end
        else
            puts "no temp file."
        end
        return fileName
    end
end

	# ãƒ«ãƒ¼ãƒˆã‹ã‚‰ãƒ•ã‚©ãƒ«ãƒ€ã®ä¸€è¦§ã‚’å–å¾—ã™ã‚‹
	def folders(count=@defaultCount)
		folders = @nameSpace.Folders
		@folderNum = 1
		folders.each do |f|
			if count < @folderNum then
				break
			end
			GC.start
			puts f.Name
			puts "N | CNT | FolderName"
			findFolder(f.EntryId)
		end
	end
	# entoryIdã‚’å…ƒã«ãƒ•ã‚©ãƒ«ãƒ€åã‚’å†å¸°çš„ã«å–å¾—ã™ã‚‹
	def findFolder(entryId, count=@defaultCount)
		folder(entryId).Folders.each do |f|
			if count < @folderNum then
				break
			end
			begin
				puts "#{@folderNum} | " + 
				      "#{f.Items.Count}é€š | " + 
				      "#{f.Name}"
				      # + " | #{f.Parent.Name}"
				@folder[@folderNum.to_s] = f.EntryId
				@folderNum += 1
				findFolder(f.EntryId)
			rescue => ex
				putsError(ex)
			end
		end
	end

	# entryIdã‚’å…ƒã«å¯¾è±¡ãƒ•ã‚©ãƒ«ãƒ€ã®ãƒ¡ãƒ¼ãƒ«ä¸€è¦§ã‚’å–å¾—ã™ã‚‹
	def mails(entryId, count=@defaultCount)
		f = @nameSpace.GetFolderFromID(entryId)
		if f.Items.Count == 0 then
			raise "ãƒ•ã‚©ãƒ«ãƒ€ã«ãƒ¡ãƒ¼ãƒ«ãŒã‚ã‚Šã¾ã›ã‚“ã€‚"
		end
		@mailNum = 1
		puts "N | A | SentOn              | Name       | Subject"
		f.Items.each do |mail|
			if count < @mailNum then
				break
			end
			GC.start
			puts "#{@mailNum} | " +
						"#{mail.Attachments.Count} | " +
						"#{mail.SentOn} | " +
						"#{mail.SenderName.unpack('A10')} | " +
						"#{mail.Subject.unpack('A35')}"
			@mail[@mailNum.to_s] = mail.EntryId
			@mailNum += 1
		end
	end

	# @saveRootPathä¸‹ã«ãƒ‡ã‚£ãƒ¬ã‚¯ãƒˆãƒªã‚’ä½œæˆã™ã‚‹
	def mkdir(mail)
		# å—ä¿¡æ—¥ã®YYYYMMDD
		receivedTime = Date.strptime(mail.SentOn, "%Y/%m/%d").strftime("%Y%m%d")
		@saveDir = "#{@saveRootPath}" + 
								"#{receivedTime}_#{replace(mail.Subject)}\\"
		if !File.exist?(@saveDir) then
			Dir.mkdir(@saveDir)
		end
	end
	# @saveDirä¸‹ã«Subject.txtãƒ•ã‚¡ã‚¤ãƒ«ã‚’ä½œæˆã—ãƒ¡ãƒ¼ãƒ«å†…å®¹ã‚’æ›¸ãã“ã‚€
	def saveMail(mail)
		fullPath = "#{@saveDir}#{self.replace(mail.Subject)}.txt"
		File.open(fullPath, "w") do |file|
			file.write "SENDER      : #{mail.SenderName}" + 
									"(#{mail.SenderEmailAddress})\n"
			file.write "TO          : #{mail.To}\n"
			file.write "CC          : #{mail.CC}\n"
			file.write "ReceivedTime: #{mail.SentOn}\n"
			file.write "SUBJECT     : #{mail.Subject}\n"
			file.write "BODY        : \n#{mail.Body}\n"
			#puts "â– æœ¬æ–‡ä¿å­˜ã€€ã€€ã€€ã€€:#{fullPath}"
			puts "â– æœ¬æ–‡ä¿å­˜ã€€ã€€ã€€ã€€:#{self.replace(mail.Subject)}"
		end
	end
	# @saveDirä¸‹ã«æ·»ä»˜ãƒ•ã‚¡ã‚¤ãƒ«ã‚’ä¿å­˜ã™ã‚‹
	def saveFile(mail)
		if mail.Attachments.Count != 0 then
			mail.Attachments.each do |item|
				item.SaveAsFile("#{@saveDir}#{self.replace(item.FileName)}")
				puts "â– æ·»ä»˜ãƒ•ã‚¡ã‚¤ãƒ«ä¿å­˜:#{item.FileName}"
				
				# ãƒ•ã‚¡ã‚¤ãƒ«ãŒ.msgã ã£ãŸå ´åˆæ·»ä»˜ãƒ•ã‚¡ã‚¤ãƒ«ã‚’ã¶ã£ã“ã¬ã
				# ãƒ•ã‚©ãƒ«ãƒ€åã‚‚å¤‰æ›´
				if item.FileName =~ /.*\.msg/ then 
					msg = MsgParse.new
					msg.inputMsg("#{@saveDir}#{self.replace(item.FileName)}")
					fileName = msg.saveFile(@saveDir)
					renameFolder(mail, fileName)
				end
			end
		else
			puts "æ·»ä»˜ãƒ•ã‚¡ã‚¤ãƒ«ã¯ã‚ã‚Šã¾ã›ã‚“ã€‚"
		end
	end

# -*- encoding: UTF-8 -*-
require "win32ole"

# ä¿å­˜ãƒ‡ã‚£ãƒ¬ã‚¯ãƒˆãƒªåŸºæº–ã€‚ä¸€å¿œãƒã‚¤ãƒ‰ã‚­ãƒ¥ãƒ¡ãƒ³ãƒˆã¸
SaveRootPath = "#{ENV["USERPROFILE"]}\\My Documents"

class Outlook
	def initialize
		# Outlookã«æ¥ç¶š
		ol = WIN32OLE::connect("Outlook.Application")
		# NameSpaceå–å¾—(getNameSpaceã®å¼•æ•°ã¯"MAPI"ã®ã¿)
		@nameSpace = ol.getNameSpace("MAPI")
	end

	# EntryIDã‚’å…ƒã«ãƒ¡ãƒ¼ãƒ«ã‚’å–å¾—	
	def mail(entryId)
		item = @nameSpace.GetItemFromID(entryId)
		return item
	end
	
	# ãƒ¡ãƒ¼ãƒ«ã®ä¸€è¦§ã‚’å–å¾—
	def mails
		# GetDefaultFolder(6)ã¯å—ä¿¡ãƒˆãƒ¬ã‚¤
		folder = @nameSpace.GetDefaultFolder(6)
		folder.Items.each do |mail|
			GC.start
			yield mail
		end
	end	
end

outlook = Outlook.new
# ãƒ¡ãƒ¼ãƒ«ã®ã‚¿ã‚¤ãƒˆãƒ«ã€é€ä¿¡æ—¥æ™‚ã€EntryIDä¸€æ¬„ã‚’è¡¨ç¤º
outlook.mails do |mail|
	#puts "To     :#{mail.To}"
	puts "#{mail.SentOn} | #{mail.Subject.unpack("a50")}"
	puts "#{mail.EntryID}"
end

# å…¥åŠ›å¾…ã¡ã€‚ä¿å­˜ã—ãŸã„ãƒ¡ãƒ¼ãƒ«ã®EntryIdã‚’è²¼ã‚Šã¤ã‘
mail = outlook.mail(STDIN.gets.chomp)
#puts mail.Attachments.ole_methods
#puts mail.Attachments.Item(1).ole_methods

# æ·»ä»˜ãƒ•ã‚¡ã‚¤ãƒ«ã®ãƒ•ã‚¡ã‚¤ãƒ«åã‚’å–å¾—
file = mail.Attachments.Item(1).FileName
# RootPathä¸‹ã«æ·»ä»˜ãƒ•ã‚¡ã‚¤ãƒ«åã®ãƒ‡ã‚£ãƒ¬ã‚¯ãƒˆãƒªä½œæˆ
SaveDir = "#{SaveRootPath}\\#{file.split(".")[0]}"
Dir.mkdir(SaveDir)

# æ·»ä»˜ãƒ•ã‚¡ã‚¤ãƒ«ä¿å­˜
mail.Attachments.Item(1).SaveAsFile("#{SaveDir}\\#{file}")

# ãƒ‡ã‚£ãƒ¬ã‚¯ãƒˆãƒªä¸‹ã«ã‚¿ã‚¤ãƒˆãƒ«.txtãƒ•ã‚¡ã‚¤ãƒ«ã‚’ä½œæˆã—é€ä¿¡è€…ã€ã‚¿ã‚¤ãƒˆãƒ«ã€æœ¬æ–‡ã‚’æ›¸ãã“ã‚€
File.open("#{SaveDir}\\#{mail.Subject}.txt", "w") do |file|
	file.write "SENDER      : #{mail.SenderName}(#{mail.SenderEmailAddress})\n"
	file.write "TO          : #{mail.To}\n"
	file.write "CC          : #{mail.CC}\n"
	file.write "ReceivedTime: #{mail.SentOn}\n"
	file.write "SUBJECT     : #{mail.Subject}\n"
	file.write "BODY: \n#{mail.Body}\n"
end

åŸºæœ¬çš„ã«å‚è€ƒã‚µã‚¤ãƒˆã®ã€ŒRuby ã‹ã‚‰ Outlook ã‚’æ“ä½œã™ã‚‹ã€ã®ç« ã®é€šã‚Šã«é€²ã‚ã°ã€ã¾ãšå—ä¿¡ãƒˆãƒ¬ã‚¤ã®ä¸€è¦§ã‚’å–ã£ã¦ã“ã‚Œã‚‹ã¾ã§ã¯ã„ã‘ã¾ã™ã€‚è©°ã¾ã£ãŸã®ã¯æ·»ä»˜ãƒ•ã‚¡ã‚¤ãƒ«ã®æ‰±ã„â€¦Attachmentsã‚ªãƒ–ã‚¸ã‚§ã‚¯ãƒˆã®æ‰±ã„æ–¹ã§ã—ãŸã€‚

  • ã¾ãšã€è‡ªä½œã®Outlook#mailã‚’å‘¼ã³å‡ºã—ç‰¹å®šã®ãƒ¡ãƒ¼ãƒ«ã‚’å–å¾—ã—ã¾ã™ã€‚(EntryIDã‚’å…ƒã«)
	# EntryIDã‚’å…ƒã«ãƒ¡ãƒ¼ãƒ«ã‚’å–å¾—	
	def mail(entryId)
		item = @nameSpace.GetItemFromID(entryId)

CreatedNonceä½œæˆæ™‚ã®ã‚¿ã‚¤ãƒ ã‚¹ã‚¿ãƒ³ãƒ—ã‚’ISO-8601è¡¨è¨˜ã§è¨˜è¿°ã—ãŸã‚‚ã®

ã“ã‚Œã‚‰ã®ãƒ‡ãƒ¼ã‚¿ã‚’X-WSSEãƒ˜ãƒƒãƒ€ã«ä»¥ä¸‹ã®å½¢å¼ã§æ ¼ç´ã—ã¾ã™ã€‚

<entry xmlns="http://purl.org/atom/ns#">
                <title>dummy</title>
                <link rel="related" type="text/html" href="ãƒ–ãƒƒã‚¯ãƒãƒ¼ã‚¯ã™ã‚‹URL" />
                <summary type="text/plain">ãƒ–ãƒƒã‚¯ãƒãƒ¼ã‚¯ã‚³ãƒ¡ãƒ³ãƒˆ</summary>
</entry>

ä½œæˆã•ã‚ŒãŸãƒ˜ãƒƒãƒ€ã¨ãƒ‡ãƒ¼ã‚¿ã¯ã“ã‚“ãªæ„Ÿã˜ã«ãªã‚Šã¾ã™ã€‚

æœ€å¾Œã«ä½œæˆã—ãŸãƒ˜ãƒƒãƒ€ã¨ãƒ–ãƒƒã‚¯ãƒãƒ¼ã‚¯ãƒ‡ãƒ¼ã‚¿ã‚’http://b.hatena.ne.jp/atom/postã¸ãƒã‚¹ãƒˆã™ã‚‹ã¨ã€‚

ãŠãŠã€‚

æ­£å¸¸ã«ä½œæˆã•ã‚ŒãŸå ´åˆã¯ã€ã‚¹ãƒ†ãƒ¼ã‚¿ã‚¹ã‚³ãƒ¼ãƒ‰ã¯201ãŒè¿”ã£ã¦ãã‚‹ã‚ˆã†ã§ã™ã€‚

ã‚½ãƒ¼ã‚¹

Gistã¯ç›´æ¥è²¼ã‚Œã‚‹ã‘ã©GitHubã¯è²¼ã‚Œãªã„ã®ã­â€¦ã€‚ã“ã“ã«ã‚ã‚Šã¾ã™ã€‚gosyujin/hatena Â· GitHub

require 'rubygems'
require 'pit'
require 'time'
require 'digest/sha1'
require 'net/http'
require 'uri'
require 'nkf'

# wsseèªè¨¼ã‚’è¡Œã†
def wsse(hatena_id, password)
	# ä¸€æ„ãªå€¤(ä»®å®Ÿè£…)
	nonce = [Time.now.to_i.to_s].pack('m').gsub(/\n/, '')
	# nonceä½œæˆæ™‚ã®ã‚¿ã‚¤ãƒ ã‚¹ã‚¿ãƒ³ãƒ—ã‚’ISO-8601è¡¨è¨˜ã§è¨˜è¿°ã—ãŸã‚‚ã®
	now = Time.now.utc.iso8601
	
	# SHA1ãƒ€ã‚¤ã‚¸ã‚§ã‚¹ãƒˆåŒ–ã—ãŸæ–‡å­—åˆ—ã‚’Base64ã‚¨ãƒ³ã‚³ãƒ¼ãƒ‰
	digest = [Digest::SHA1.digest(nonce + now + password)].pack("m").gsub(/\n/, '')
	
	{ 'X-WSSE' => sprintf(
		%Q<UsernameToken Username="%s", PasswordDigest="%s", Nonce="%s", Created="%s">,
		hatena_id, digest, nonce, now)
	}
end

# ã¯ã¦ãƒ–ç™»éŒ²ç”¨xmlã‚’ç”Ÿæˆã™ã‚‹
def getXml(link, summary)
	%Q(
	<entry xmlns="http://purl.org/atom/ns#">
		<title>dummy</title>
		<link rel="related" type="text/html" href="#{link}" />
		<summary type="text/plain">#{summary}</summary>
	</entry>
	)
end

b_url = ARGV.shift || abort("Usage: hatenabookmark.rb <url> <comment>")
b_comment = ARGV.shift

# ã‚¨ãƒ³ãƒ‰ãƒã‚¤ãƒ³ãƒˆ
url = "http://b.hatena.ne.jp/atom/post"

# ãƒ¦ãƒ¼ã‚¶æƒ…å ±èª­ã¿è¾¼ã¿
hatena = Pit.get("hatena", :require => {
	# ã¯ã¦ãªIDã¨ãƒ‘ã‚¹ãƒ¯ãƒ¼ãƒ‰
	"hatena_id" => "your hatena_id", 
	"password" => "your password", 
})
# pitã‚’ä½¿ã‚ãšã«ã¹ãŸæ›¸ãç”¨
# hatena = {
#	hatena_id => HATENA_ID, 
#	password = PASSWORD
# }

# WSSEèªè¨¼
header = wsse(hatena["hatena_id"], hatena["password"])

uri = URI.parse(url)
proxy_class = Net::HTTP::Proxy(ENV["PROXY"], 8080)
http = proxy_class.new(uri.host)
http.start do |http|
	# èª­ã¿è¾¼ã‚“ã æ–‡å­—åˆ—ã‚’utf-8ã«å¤‰æ›
	# b_url = NKF.nkf('-w', b_url)
	# b_comment = NKF.nkf('-w', b_comment)
	
	# ã‚¨ãƒ³ãƒ‰ãƒã‚¤ãƒ³ãƒˆã¸POST
	res = http.post(uri.path, getXml(b_url, b_comment), header)
	if res.code == "201" then
		print "Bookmark success: #{b_url}\n"
	else
		print "#{res.code} Error: #{b_url}\n"
	end
end

å‚è€ƒã«ã—ãŸã‚µã‚¤ãƒˆã«ãƒˆãƒ©ãƒƒã‚¯ãƒãƒƒã‚¯æ‰“ã¨ã†ã¨æ€ã£ãŸã‘ã©å‰ã™ãã¦å¿˜ã‚ŒãŸï¼ï¼œã€€è¦‹ã¤ã‘ãŸã‚‰è¿½è¨˜ã—ã¾ã™ã€‚

require 'uri'
require 'net/http'
# http://rubyforge.org/snippet/detail.php?type=snippet&id=148
require 'simplejsonparser'
require 'pp'

# RILå–å¾—ç”¨ã®URL
url = "https://readitlaterlist.com/v2/get"

# ã‚¢ã‚«ã‚¦ãƒ³ãƒˆåã¨ãƒ‘ã‚¹ãƒ¯ãƒ¼ãƒ‰
username = "kk_Ataka"
password = PASSWORD
# apikey
apikey = APIKEY
# format json or xml
format = "json"

# ãƒ‘ãƒ©ãƒ¡ãƒ¼ã‚¿ä½œæˆ
param = "username=#{username}&password=#{password}&apikey=#{apikey}&format=#{format}"

# GETã™ã‚‹
uri = URI.parse(url)
proxy_class = Net::HTTP::Proxy(ARGV[0], 8080)
http = proxy_class.new(uri.host)
http.start do |http|
        res = http.get(uri.path + "?#{param}")
        if res.code == "200" then
                json = res.body
                # jsonparseã§parseã—ã¦ã‚‚ã‚‰ã†
                jsonparse = JsonParser.new.parse(json)

                pp jsonparse
        else
                print "#{res.code}\n"
        end
end

ã€€ã€€ã€€ã€€"tags":"comma,seperated,list",

				# listã®ã‚­ãƒ¼ã‚’å–å¾—

ã‚¿ãƒ¼ãƒŸãƒŠãƒ«ã‹ã‚‰OAuthèªè¨¼ã‚’ã‚­ãƒ¡ã¦ã€ã‚¿ã‚¤ãƒ ãƒ©ã‚¤ãƒ³ã‚’è¦‹ã‚‰ã‚Œã‚‹ã‚ˆã†ã«ãªã‚Šã¾ã—ãŸã€‚æœ€å¾Œã«ã‚¿ãƒ¼ãƒŸãƒŠãƒ«ã‹ã‚‰ãƒ„ã‚¤ãƒ¼ãƒˆãŒå‡ºæ¥ã‚Œã°ä¸€å¿œTwitterã®è¦‹ã‚‹ãƒ»æ›¸ããŒãƒ©ã‚¤ãƒ–ãƒ©ãƒªç„¡ã—ã§ã§ããŸã“ã¨ã«ãªã‚Šã¾ã™ã€‚

  • signatureã‚’ä½œæˆã—ãŸã‚‰ã€headerã‹ã‚‰statusã‚’æ¶ˆã—ã¾ã™

oauth_consumer_key=XXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX,oauth_nonce=341d852d61cdc3c22e3e847b0ab69d20,oauth_signature=MR5WEJ1qHuE49ozgRYduNJ%2BBiCs%3D,oauth_signature_method=HMAC-SHA1,oauth_timestamp=1295785315,oauth_token=99999999-YYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYY,oauth_version=1.0
  • é€£çµã—ãŸä¸Šè¨˜ã®å€¤ã‚’Authorizationãƒ˜ãƒƒãƒ€ã«å…¥ã‚Œã‚‹ã€‚å…¥ã‚ŒãŸå¾Œã¯ã“ã‚“ãªæ„Ÿã˜ã€‚
"Authorization"=>"OAuth oauth_consumer_key=XXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX,oauth_nonce=341d852d61cdc3c22e3e847b0ab69d20,oauth_signature=MR5WEJ1qHuE49ozgRYduNJ%2BBiCs%3D,oauth_signature_method=HMAC-SHA1,oauth_timestamp=1295785315,oauth_token=99999999-YYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYY,oauth_version=1.0"
  • Authorizationãƒ˜ãƒƒãƒ€ã‚’ä½œæˆã—ãŸã‚‰http://api.twitter.com/1/statuses/home_timeline.jsonã¸POSTã€‚ã¾ãŸã€ãƒ„ã‚¤ãƒ¼ãƒˆæœ¬æ–‡ã‚’ã€Œstatus=æœ¬æ–‡ã€ã®å½¢ã§ãã£ã¤ã‘ã‚‹

çµæœ

ä»¥ä¸Šã§ã€Twitterã«ãƒ„ã‚¤ãƒ¼ãƒˆãŒå®Œäº†ã—ã¾ã—ãŸï¼ã€€ãŠã£ã±ã„ããŸãƒ¼ãƒ¼

ã‚½ãƒ¼ã‚¹

ã‚½ãƒ¼ã‚¹ã¯ã“ã‚“ãªæ„Ÿã˜ã§ã™ã€‚

# -*- encoding: UTF-8 -*-

require 'openssl'
require 'uri'
require 'net/http'
require 'nkf'
require 'time'

# ç½²å
def sigunature(method, 
		consumer_secret, 
		oauth_token_secret, 
		url, 
		oauth_header=nil)
	# sigunature_keyã®ä½œæˆ
	# ãƒªã‚¯ã‚¨ã‚¹ãƒˆãƒˆãƒ¼ã‚¯ãƒ³æ™‚ã¯"CONSUMER_SECRET&"(ã‚¢ãƒ³ãƒ‰ãŒå…¥ã£ã¦ã„ã‚‹)
	# ã‚¢ã‚¯ã‚»ã‚¹ãƒˆãƒ¼ã‚¯ãƒ³æ™‚ã¯"CONSUMER_SECRET&OAUTH_TOKEN_SECRET"ã¨ã—ã¦ä½¿ç”¨
	sigunature_key = consumer_secret + "&"
	if !oauth_token_secret.nil? then
		sigunature_key += oauth_token_secret
	end

	param = sort_and_concat(oauth_header)

	# ãƒ¡ã‚½ãƒƒãƒ‰ + URL + ãƒ‘ãƒ©ãƒ¡ãƒ¼ã‚¿
	value = method + "&" + escape(url) + "&" + escape(param)
	# hmac_sha1
	sha1 = OpenSSL::HMAC.digest(OpenSSL::Digest::SHA1.new, sigunature_key, value)
	# base64
	base64 = [sha1].pack('m').gsub(/\n/, '')
	return base64
end

# æ–‡å­—åˆ—ã®ã‚¨ã‚¹ã‚±ãƒ¼ãƒ—(: / = %ã‚’ã‚¨ã‚¹ã‚±ãƒ¼ãƒ—ã™ã‚‹ã€‚. _ -ã¯ãã®ã¾ã¾)
def escape(value)
	URI.escape(value, Regexp.new("[^a-zA-Z0-9._-]"))
end

# oauth_headerã®æƒ…å ±ã‚’ã‚¢ãƒ«ãƒ•ã‚¡ãƒ™ãƒƒãƒˆé †ã«ä¸¦ã¹æ›¿ãˆ & ã§çµåˆ
def sort_and_concat(oauth_header)
	oauth_header_array = oauth_header.sort
	param = ""
	oauth_header_array.each do |params|
		for i in 1..params.length
			param += params[i-1]
			if i % params.length == 0
				param += "&"
			else
				param += "="
			end
		end
	end
	param = param.slice(0, param.length-1)
end

# -------------------------------------------------------------

update_url = "http://twitter.com/statuses/update.json"

url = update_url
# ã‚³ãƒãƒ³ãƒ‰ãƒ—ãƒ­ãƒ³ãƒ—ãƒˆã¯utf8å¤‰æ›
text = escape(ARGV[0])
# text = escape(NKF.nkf('-w', ARGV[0]))
proxy = ARGV[1]

# Twitterã§ç™»éŒ²ã—ãŸã‚‰ã‚‚ã‚‰ãˆã‚‹
consumer_key = "XXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX"
consumer_secret = "YYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYY"
# Twitterã‹ã‚‰ã‚‚ã‚‰ãˆã‚‹ãƒªã‚¯ã‚¨ã‚¹ãƒˆãƒˆãƒ¼ã‚¯ãƒ³(æœ€åˆã¯ä½¿ã‚ãªã„)
oauth_token = "11111111-ZZZZZZZZZZZZZZZZZZZZZZZZZZZZZZZZZZZZZZZZZZZZ"
oauth_token_secret = "VVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVV"

# oauthãƒ‘ãƒ©ãƒ¡ãƒ¼ã‚¿ãŸã¡(æ±ºã‚æ‰“ã¡ã®ã‚‚ã®)
oauth_header = {
	# Consumer Key
	"oauth_consumer_key" => consumer_key,
	# ä¸€æ„ãªå€¤
	"oauth_nonce" => OpenSSL::Digest::Digest.hexdigest('MD5', "#{Time.now.to_f}#{rand}"), 
	# ç½²åæ–¹å¼(HMAC-SHA1)
	"oauth_signature_method" => "HMAC-SHA1",
	# ãƒªã‚¯ã‚¨ã‚¹ãƒˆç”Ÿæˆæ™‚ã®ã‚¿ã‚¤ãƒ ã‚¹ã‚¿ãƒ³ãƒ—ã®ãƒŸãƒªç§’
	"oauth_timestamp" => Time.now.to_i.to_s, 
	# ãƒãƒ¼ã‚¸ãƒ§ãƒ³(1.0)
	"oauth_version" => "1.0",

	# ã‚¢ã‚¯ã‚»ã‚¹ãƒˆãƒ¼ã‚¯ãƒ³
	"oauth_token" => oauth_token
}

# headerã«ãƒ„ã‚¤ãƒ¼ãƒˆè¿½åŠ 
oauth_header["status"] = text

# ç½²åç”Ÿæˆ
oauth_header["oauth_signature"] = sigunature("POST",
					consumer_secret,
					oauth_token_secret,
					url,
					oauth_header)

# headerã‹ã‚‰ãƒ„ã‚¤ãƒ¼ãƒˆå‰Šé™¤
oauth_header.delete("status")
# ç½²åã‚¨ãƒ³ã‚³ãƒ¼ãƒ‰
oauth_header["oauth_signature"] = escape(oauth_header["oauth_signature"])
param = sort_and_concat(oauth_header)

param = param.gsub('&', ',')

header = {
	"Authorization" => "OAuth " + param
}

# POST
uri = URI.parse(update_url)
proxy_class = Net::HTTP::Proxy(proxy, 8080)
http = proxy_class.new(uri.host)
http.start do |http|
	res = http.post(uri.path, "status=#{text}", header)

	if res.code == "200" then
		print "#{res.code} tweet: #{ARGV[0]}\n"
	else
		print "ERROR: #{res.code}\n #{res.body}\n"
	end
end

*1: å®Ÿéš›ã¯ã‚¤ãƒ³ãƒ‡ãƒ³ãƒˆã¨ã‹ãªã—ã€‚

ã§ã™ã€‚OAuthèªè¨¼ã—ã¦ç²å¾—ã—ãŸã‚¢ã‚¯ã‚»ã‚¹ãƒˆãƒ¼ã‚¯ãƒ³ã€oauth_tokenã¨oauth_token_secretã‚’éšæ‰€ã§ä½¿ã„ã¾ã™ã€‚ãã—ã¦ä½œæˆã—ãŸsignatureã¨ä»–ã®ãƒ‘ãƒ©ãƒ¡ãƒ¼ã‚¿ã‚’http://api.twitter.com/1/statuses/home_timeline.jsonã®ãŠã—ã‚Šã«ãã£ã¤ã‘ã¦(ä»Šå›ã¯)GETãƒªã‚¯ã‚¨ã‚¹ãƒˆã€‚

åˆè¦‹ã ã¨ã“ã‚ŒÃ—20ä»¶ã®ãƒ‡ãƒ¼ã‚¿ãŒæ”¹è¡Œãªã—ã§ãšã‚‰ã‚Šã¨ç”»é¢ã«ä¸¦ã¶ã®ã§ã€é¢é£Ÿã‚‰ã£ãŸã®ã§ã™ãŒã€ã‚ˆãè¦‹ã¦ã¿ã‚‹ã¨è¦‹è¦šãˆãŒã‚ã‚‹ãƒ‡ãƒ¼ã‚¿ã‚‚ã¡ã‚‰ã»ã‚‰â€¦â€¦ã€‚

ä¾‹ãˆã°ã€userã®ä¸­ã«ã‚ã‚‹screen_nameã¯kk_Atakaâ€¦â€¦ã“ã‚Œä¿ºã‚„ï¼ã€€ã‚ã¨ã¯ã€text:testã‚‚ã€testã£ã¦ãƒ„ã‚¤ãƒ¼ãƒˆã—ãŸå¾Œã ã£ãŸã®ã§ã€ãƒ„ã‚¤ãƒ¼ãƒˆå†…å®¹ãªã®ã‹ãªã¨ã€‚

ãƒªãƒ—ãƒ©ã‚¤ã—ãŸã¨ãã¯in_reply_toç³»ã®ã‚­ãƒ¼ã«ãƒªãƒ—ãƒ©ã‚¤ç›¸æ‰‹ã®idã‚„screen_nameãŒå…¥ã£ã¦ã„ã‚‹ã¨æ€ã„ã¾ã™ã€‚

ã‚“ã§ã€ã“ã®ãƒ‡ãƒ¼ã‚¿ã‚’ã©ã†ã‚„ã£ã¦è§£æã—ã‚ˆã†ã‹â€¦â€¦ã¨æ€ã£ã¦ã‚°ã‚°ã£ã¦ã¿ã‚‹ã¨ã€jsonã‚’parseã—ã¦ãƒãƒƒã‚·ãƒ¥ã«ã—ã¦ãã‚Œã‚‹ãƒ—ãƒ­ã‚°ãƒ©ãƒ ãŒã€‚@webos_goodiesã•ã‚“ã®Ruby ç”¨ JSON ãƒ‘ãƒ¼ã‚µãƒ¼ã‚’æ›´æ–°ã€ JSON ã¸ã®å¤‰æ›ã‚‚è¿½åŠ  - WebOS Goodiesã“ã®ãƒ—ãƒ­ã‚°ãƒ©ãƒ ã‚’ã‚ã‚ŠãŒãŸãä½¿ã‚ã›ã¦ã„ãŸã ãã¾ã—ãŸã€‚

ã‚½ãƒ¼ã‚¹ã¯ã“ã‚“ãªæ„Ÿã˜ã€‚ä¸Šè¨˜ã®parserã¯ä¸‹è¨˜ã®rbãƒ•ã‚¡ã‚¤ãƒ«ã¨åŒã˜ãƒ‡ã‚£ãƒ¬ã‚¯ãƒˆãƒªã€ã‚‚ã—ãã¯ãƒ‘ã‚¹ã®é€šã£ã¦ã„ã‚‹å ´æ‰€ã«simplejsonparser.rbã¨ã—ã¦é…å‚™ã—ã¾ã—ãŸã€‚

require 'openssl'
require 'uri'
require 'net/http'
# http://webos-goodies.jp/archives/51071565.html
require 'simplejsonparser'
require 'nkf'
require 'time'

# signatureä½œæˆ
def signature(method, consumer_secret, oauth_token_secret, url, oauth_header)
	# signature_keyã®ä½œæˆ
	# ãƒªã‚¯ã‚¨ã‚¹ãƒˆãƒˆãƒ¼ã‚¯ãƒ³æ™‚ã¯"CONSUMER_SECRET&"(ã‚¢ãƒ³ãƒ‰ãŒå…¥ã£ã¦ã„ã‚‹)
	# ã‚¢ã‚¯ã‚»ã‚¹ãƒˆãƒ¼ã‚¯ãƒ³æ™‚ã¯"CONSUMER_SECRET&OAUTH_TOKEN_SECRET"ã¨ã—ã¦ä½¿ç”¨
	signature_key = consumer_secret + "&"
	if !oauth_token_secret.nil? then
		signature_key += oauth_token_secret
	end

	# oauth_headerã®ãƒ‘ãƒ©ãƒ¡ãƒ¼ã‚¿ã‚’ã‚½ãƒ¼ãƒˆã—ã¦é€£çµ
	param = sort_and_concat(oauth_header)

	# httpãƒ¡ã‚½ãƒƒãƒ‰ã¨URLã¨ãƒ‘ãƒ©ãƒ¡ãƒ¼ã‚¿ã‚’&ã§é€£çµã™ã‚‹
	value = method + "&" + escape(url) + "&" + escape(param)
	# hmac_sha1
	sha1 = OpenSSL::HMAC.digest(OpenSSL::Digest::SHA1.new, signature_key, value)
	# base64
	base64 = [sha1].pack('m').gsub(/\n/, '')
	return base64
end

# æ–‡å­—åˆ—ã®ã‚¨ã‚¹ã‚±ãƒ¼ãƒ—(: / = %ã‚’ã‚¨ã‚¹ã‚±ãƒ¼ãƒ—ã™ã‚‹ã€‚. _ -ã¯ãã®ã¾ã¾)
def escape(value)
	URI.escape(value, Regexp.new("[^a-zA-Z0-9._-]"))
end

# oauth_headerã®æƒ…å ±ã‚’ã‚¢ãƒ«ãƒ•ã‚¡ãƒ™ãƒƒãƒˆé †ã«ä¸¦ã¹æ›¿ãˆ & ã§çµåˆ
def sort_and_concat(oauth_header)
	oauth_header_array = oauth_header.sort
	param = ""
	oauth_header_array.each do |params|
		for i in 1..params.length
			param += params[i-1]
			if i % params.length == 0
				param += "&"
			else
				param += "="
			end
		end
	end
	param = param.slice(0, param.length-1)
end

# è‡ªåˆ†ã®ã‚¿ã‚¤ãƒ ãƒ©ã‚¤ãƒ³å–å¾—ç”¨ã®URL
home_timeline_url = "http://api.twitter.com/1/statuses/home_timeline.json"

# Twitterã§ç™»éŒ²ã—ãŸã‚‰ã‚‚ã‚‰ãˆã‚‹
consumer_key = "XXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX"
consumer_secret = "YYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYY"

# Twitterã‹ã‚‰ã‚‚ã‚‰ãˆã‚‹ã‚¢ã‚¯ã‚»ã‚¹ãƒˆãƒ¼ã‚¯ãƒ³
oauth_token = "11111111-ZZZZZZZZZZZZZZZZZZZZZZZZZZZZZZZZZZZZZZZZZZZZ"
oauth_token_secret = "VVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVVV"

# oauthãƒ‘ãƒ©ãƒ¡ãƒ¼ã‚¿ãŸã¡
oauth_header = {
	# Consumer Key
	"oauth_consumer_key" => consumer_key,
	# ä¸€æ„ãªå€¤(ä»Šå›ã¯é©å½“ã«å®Ÿè£…)
	"oauth_nonce" => "AAAAAAAA",
	# ç½²åæ–¹å¼(HMAC-SHA1)
	"oauth_signature_method" => "HMAC-SHA1",
	# ãƒªã‚¯ã‚¨ã‚¹ãƒˆç”Ÿæˆæ™‚ã®ã‚¿ã‚¤ãƒ ã‚¹ã‚¿ãƒ³ãƒ—(ãƒŸãƒªç§’)
	"oauth_timestamp" => Time.now.to_i.to_s,
	# ãƒãƒ¼ã‚¸ãƒ§ãƒ³(1.0)
	"oauth_version" => "1.0",

	# ã‚¢ã‚¯ã‚»ã‚¹ãƒˆãƒ¼ã‚¯ãƒ³
	"oauth_token" => oauth_token 
}

# signatureä½œæˆ
oauth_header["oauth_signature"] = signature("GET", 
					consumer_secret, 
					oauth_token_secret, 
					home_timeline_url, 
					oauth_header)

# GETã™ã‚‹
uri = URI.parse(home_timeline_url)
proxy_class = Net::HTTP::Proxy(ARGV[0], 8080)
http = proxy_class.new(uri.host)
http.start do |http|
	# oauth_headerã®ãƒ‘ãƒ©ãƒ¡ãƒ¼ã‚¿ã‚’ã‚½ãƒ¼ãƒˆã—ã¦é€£çµ
	param = sort_and_concat(oauth_header)
	
	res = http.get(uri.path + "?#{param}")
	if res.code == "200" then
		json = res.body
		# simplejsonparserã§parseã—ã¦ã‚‚ã‚‰ã†
		jsonparse = JsonParser.new.parse(json)

		# é€†é †ã«ã—ã¦å¤ã„ç‰©ã‹ã‚‰å–å¾—ã™ã‚‹
		jsonparse = jsonparse.reverse

		for i in 0..jsonparse.length-1

			# æ—¥ä»˜ãƒ•ã‚©ãƒ¼ãƒãƒƒãƒˆã‚’å¹´/æœˆ/æ—¥ æ™‚é–“ã«å¤‰æ›´
			time = Time.parse(jsonparse[i]["created_at"]).strftime("%Y/%m/%d %X")

			# SJISå¤‰æ›(ã‚³ãƒãƒ³ãƒ‰ãƒ—ãƒ­ãƒ³ãƒ—ãƒˆã§è¦‹ã‚‹ç”¨)
			# print NKF.nkf('-s', "â– #{jsonparse[i]["user"]["screen_name"]} (#{jsonparse[i]["user"]["name"]}) #{time}\nã€€#{jsonparse[i]["text"]}\n")
			print "â– #{jsonparse[i]["user"]["screen_name"]} (#{jsonparse[i]["user"]["name"]}) #{time}\nã€€#{jsonparse[i]["text"]}\n"
		end
	else
		print "#{res.code}\n"
	end
end

çµæœã¯ã“ã†ã€‚ã‚¿ã‚¤ãƒ ãƒ©ã‚¤ãƒ³ã‚²ãƒƒãƒˆãƒ¼ï¼

Windowsç”¨â€¦â€¦

ã‚½ãƒ¼ã‚¹ã®æœ€å¾Œã€parseã‚‚çµ‚ã‚ã£ã¦ãã®ä¸­ã‹ã‚‰ã»ã—ã„ã‚­ãƒ¼ã®å€¤ã‚’å–ã‚Šå‡ºã—ã¦ã‚‹ã¨ã“ã‚ã§ã€‚

			# SJISå¤‰æ›(ã‚³ãƒãƒ³ãƒ‰ãƒ—ãƒ­ãƒ³ãƒ—ãƒˆã§è¦‹ã‚‹ç”¨)
			# print NKF.nkf('-s', "â– #{jsonparse[i]["user"]["screen_name"]} (#{jsonparse[i]["user"]["name"]}) #{time}\nã€€#{jsonparse[i]["text"]}\n")

SJISå¤‰æ›ã—ã¦ã‚‹ã¨ã“ã‚ãŒã‚ã‚‹ã‚“ã§ã™ãŒã€ã“ã‚Œã€ã‚‚ã¨ã‚‚ã¨Windowsã®ã‚³ãƒãƒ³ãƒ‰ãƒ—ãƒ­ãƒ³ãƒ—ãƒˆã§å‹•ã‹ã—ãŸãã¦ä½œã£ã¦ã„ãŸã‚‚ã®ãªã‚“ã§ã™ã€‚ã§ã‚‚ã‚³ãƒãƒ³ãƒ‰ãƒ—ãƒ­ãƒ³ãƒ—ãƒˆã£ã¦æ–‡å­—ã‚³ãƒ¼ãƒ‰ãŒSJISã®ã‚ˆã†ã§ãã®ã¾ã¾è¡¨ç¤ºã™ã‚‹ã¨æ–‡å­—åŒ–ã‘èµ·ã“ã™ã®ã§ã“ã†ã„ã†å¯¾å¿œã‚’ã€‚

ä¸€å¿œè»½ãã‚°ã‚°ã£ãŸæ„Ÿã˜ã ã¨ã€ã‚³ãƒãƒ³ãƒ‰ãƒ—ãƒ­ãƒ³ãƒ—ãƒˆã§ã‚‚Unicodeæ–‡å­—ã‚’èª­ã‚ã‚‹ã‚ˆã†ãªã®ã§ã™ãŒâ€¦â€¦ã€‚

entry.title: Rubyã§Twitterã®OAuthèªè¨¼ã‚’ã—ã¦ã¿ã‚‹ ãã®2
entry.content:
å‰å›ã®ã‚¨ãƒ³ãƒˆãƒª ã§ã¯ã€ãƒªã‚¯ã‚¨ã‚¹ãƒˆãƒˆãƒ¼ã‚¯ãƒ³ã¾ã§ç™ºè¡Œã—ã¦ã‚‚ã‚‰ãˆã¾ã—ãŸã€‚ã ã‚‚ã‚“ã§ä»Šå›ã¯å‰å›ã«ç¶šã„ã¦ã‚¢ã‚¯ã‚»ã‚¹ãƒˆãƒ¼ã‚¯ãƒ³ã‚’ç™ºè¡Œã—ã¦ã‚‚ã‚‰ã„ã¾ã™ã€‚ã‚¢ã‚¯ã‚»ã‚¹ãƒˆãƒ¼ã‚¯ãƒ³ç™ºè¡Œã®æµã‚Œã¨ã—ã¦ã¯ã€

  1. ä»Šã‚‚ã‚‰ã£ãŸãƒªã‚¯ã‚¨ã‚¹ãƒˆãƒˆãƒ¼ã‚¯ãƒ³ã‚’ä»˜åŠ ã—ã¦ http://twitter.com/oauth/authorize ã¸ã‚¢ã‚¯ã‚»ã‚¹ã™ã‚‹
  2. ç”»é¢ã«è¡¨ç¤ºã•ã‚Œã‚‹PINã‚³ãƒ¼ãƒ‰(oauth_verifier)ã‚’æ§ãˆã‚‹
  3. ãƒªã‚¯ã‚¨ã‚¹ãƒˆãƒˆãƒ¼ã‚¯ãƒ³ã¨PINã‚³ãƒ¼ãƒ‰ã‚’ã‚’ä»˜åŠ ã—ã¦ http://twitter.com/oauth/access_token ã¸ã‚¢ã‚¯ã‚»ã‚¹ã™ã‚‹

è¡Œãã¾ã™ã€‚

PINã‚³ãƒ¼ãƒ‰ã‚’ç™ºè¡Œã—ã¦ã‚‚ã‚‰ã†

ãƒªã‚¯ã‚¨ã‚¹ãƒˆãƒˆãƒ¼ã‚¯ãƒ³ã‚’ç™ºè¡Œã—ã¦ã‚‚ã‚‰ã†ã¨ã€ 

oauth_token=XXXXXXXXXX&oauth_token_secret=YYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYY&oauth_callback_confirmed=true

ã¨ã„ã†æ–‡å­—åˆ—ãŒbodyã«åŸ‹ã¾ã£ã¦ããŸã¯ãšã€‚*1

ã“ã®ä¸­ã‹ã‚‰ oauth_tokenã‚’æŠœãå‡ºã—ã€ http://twitter.com/oauth/authorize ã«ãƒ‘ãƒ©ãƒ¡ãƒ¼ã‚¿ã¨ã—ã¦ãã£ã¤ã‘ã¾ã™ã€‚ã“ã‚“ãªæ„Ÿã˜ã€‚

http://twitter.com/oauth/authorize?oauth_token=XXXXXXXXXX

ã‚¢ãƒ‰ãƒ¬ã‚¹ãŒæ­£ã—ã‘ã‚Œã°ã€ä»¥ä¸‹ã®ã‚ˆã†ãªç”»é¢ãŒå‡ºã‚‹ã¯ãšã€‚*2ã‚¢ãƒ—ãƒªã‚±ãƒ¼ã‚·ãƒ§ãƒ³ã‹ã‚‰ã®ã‚¢ã‚¯ã‚»ã‚¹ã‚’è¨±å¯ã—ã¾ã™ã‹ï¼Ÿã€€ã¨å°‹ã­ã‚‰ã‚Œã‚‹ã®ã§è¨±å¯ã™ã‚‹ã‚’é¸æŠã€‚

è¨±å¯ã™ã‚‹ã¨ã€PINã‚³ãƒ¼ãƒ‰ãŒç”»é¢ã«è¡¨ç¤ºã•ã‚Œã‚‹ã®ã§ã“ã‚Œã‚’æ§ãˆã¦ãŠãã€‚

å†åº¦signatureã‚’ä½œæˆã™ã‚‹

ã“ã®PINã‚³ãƒ¼ãƒ‰ã‚’"oauth_verify"ã¨ã—ã¦ã€‚å…ˆã»ã©URLã«è²¼ã£ã¤ã‘ãŸoauth_tokenã‚’"oauth_token"ã¨ã—ã¦ãƒ‘ãƒ©ãƒ¡ãƒ¼ã‚¿ã¨ã—ã¦æŒãŸã›ã¾ã™ã€‚

ãã—ã¦ã€ã“ã“ã§ã‚‚ã†ä¸€åº¦signatureã‚’ä½œæˆã‚’ä½œæˆã—ã¾ã™ã€‚æ³¨æ„ç‚¹ã¨ã—ã¦ã¯ã€

  1. ä»Šã¾ã§ä½¿ã£ã¦ã„ãŸoauth_signatureã¯ä¸€æ—¦æ¶ˆã—ã¦ã€ä»¥ä¸‹ã®ãƒ‘ãƒ©ãƒ¡ãƒ¼ã‚¿ã§æ–°ãŸã«ã¤ãã‚Šç›´ã™
    1. oauth_consumer_key
    2. oauth_nonce
    3. oauth_signature_method
    4. oauth_timestamp
    5. oauth_version
    6. oauth_token New!
    7. oauth_verifier New!
  2. URLã¯"http://twitter.com/oauth/access_token"ã‚’ã‚¨ã‚¹ã‚±ãƒ¼ãƒ—ã—ãŸã‚‚ã®
  3. æš—å·åŒ–ç”¨ã®ã‚­ãƒ¼ã¯"consumer_secret&oauth_token_secret"*3

ã“ã®3ç‚¹ã§ã—ã‚‡ã†ã‹ã€‚

signatureãŒä½œæˆã§ããŸã‚‰ã€å‰å›ã¨åŒæ§˜ã«ã‚¢ãƒ«ãƒ•ã‚¡ãƒ™ãƒƒãƒˆé †ã«ä¸¦ã¹ã¦é€£çµã—ã€URLã®ãŠã—ã‚Šã«ãã£ã¤ã‘ã¾ã™ã€‚URLã¯ã“ã‚“ãªæ„Ÿã˜ã«ãªã‚Šã¾ã™ã€‚

æˆåŠŸã—ãŸã‚‰ã€oauth_token, oauth_token_secret, user_id, screen_nameãŒè¿”ã£ã¦ãã¾ã™ã€‚ã“ã‚Œä¿ºã‚„ï¼ï¼

ã“ã“ã§è¿”ã—ã¦ã‚‚ã‚‰ã£ãŸoauth_tokenã¨oauth_token_secretã¯æœ¬ç‰©ãªã®ã§å¤§åˆ‡ã«ã¨ã£ã¦ãŠãï¼ã€€ã¨ã„ã†ã‚ã‘ã§ã€æ¬¡ã¯è‡ªåˆ†ã®Timelineã‚’å–å¾—ã—ã¾ã™ï¼

ã‚½ãƒ¼ã‚¹ã¯ã“ã‚“ãªæ„Ÿã˜ã€‚

require 'openssl'
require 'uri'
require 'net/http'

# signatureä½œæˆ
def signature(method, consumer_secret, oauth_token_secret, url, oauth_header)
	# signature_keyã®ä½œæˆ
	# ãƒªã‚¯ã‚¨ã‚¹ãƒˆãƒˆãƒ¼ã‚¯ãƒ³æ™‚ã¯"CONSUMER_SECRET&"(ã‚¢ãƒ³ãƒ‰ãŒå…¥ã£ã¦ã„ã‚‹)
	# ã‚¢ã‚¯ã‚»ã‚¹ãƒˆãƒ¼ã‚¯ãƒ³æ™‚ã¯"CONSUMER_SECRET&OAUTH_TOKEN_SECRET"ã¨ã—ã¦ä½¿ç”¨
	signature_key = consumer_secret + "&"
	if !oauth_token_secret.nil? then
		signature_key += oauth_token_secret
	end

	# oauth_headerã®ãƒ‘ãƒ©ãƒ¡ãƒ¼ã‚¿ã‚’ã‚½ãƒ¼ãƒˆã—ã¦é€£çµ
	param = sort_and_concat(oauth_header)

	# httpãƒ¡ã‚½ãƒƒãƒ‰ã¨URLã¨ãƒ‘ãƒ©ãƒ¡ãƒ¼ã‚¿ã‚’&ã§é€£çµã™ã‚‹
	value = method + "&" + escape(url) + "&" + escape(param)
	# hmac_sha1
	sha1 = OpenSSL::HMAC.digest(OpenSSL::Digest::SHA1.new, signature_key, value)
	# base64
	base64 = [sha1].pack('m').gsub(/\n/, '')
	return base64
end

# æ–‡å­—åˆ—ã®ã‚¨ã‚¹ã‚±ãƒ¼ãƒ—(: / = %ã‚’ã‚¨ã‚¹ã‚±ãƒ¼ãƒ—ã™ã‚‹ã€‚. _ -ã¯ãã®ã¾ã¾)
def escape(value)
	URI.escape(value, Regexp.new("[^a-zA-Z0-9._-]"))
end

# oauth_headerã®æƒ…å ±ã‚’ã‚¢ãƒ«ãƒ•ã‚¡ãƒ™ãƒƒãƒˆé †ã«ä¸¦ã¹æ›¿ãˆ & ã§çµåˆ
def sort_and_concat(oauth_header)
	oauth_header_array = oauth_header.sort
	param = ""
	oauth_header_array.each do |params|
		for i in 1..params.length
			param += params[i-1]
			if i % params.length == 0
				param += "&"
			else
				param += "="
			end
		end
	end
	param = param.slice(0, param.length-1)
end

# ãƒªã‚¯ã‚¨ã‚¹ãƒˆãƒˆãƒ¼ã‚¯ãƒ³å–å¾—ç”¨ã®URL
request_token_url = "http://twitter.com/oauth/request_token"
# PINã‚³ãƒ¼ãƒ‰å–å¾—ç”¨URL
authorize_url = "http://twitter.com/oauth/authorize"
# ã‚¢ã‚¯ã‚»ã‚¹ãƒˆãƒ¼ã‚¯ãƒ³å–å¾—ç”¨ã®URL
access_token_url = "http://twitter.com/oauth/access_token"

# Twitterã§ç™»éŒ²ã—ãŸã‚‰ã‚‚ã‚‰ãˆã‚‹
consumer_key = "XXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX"
consumer_secret = "YYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYY"

# Twitterã‹ã‚‰ã‚‚ã‚‰ãˆã‚‹ã‚¢ã‚¯ã‚»ã‚¹ãƒˆãƒ¼ã‚¯ãƒ³(æœ€åˆã¯ä½¿ã‚ãªã„)
oauth_token = ""
oauth_token_secret = ""

# oauthãƒ‘ãƒ©ãƒ¡ãƒ¼ã‚¿ãŸã¡
oauth_header = {
	# Consumer Key
	"oauth_consumer_key" => consumer_key,
	# ä¸€æ„ãªå€¤(ä»Šå›ã¯é©å½“ã«å®Ÿè£…)
	"oauth_nonce" => "AAAAAAAA",
	# ç½²åæ–¹å¼(HMAC-SHA1)
	"oauth_signature_method" => "HMAC-SHA1",
	# ãƒªã‚¯ã‚¨ã‚¹ãƒˆç”Ÿæˆæ™‚ã®ã‚¿ã‚¤ãƒ ã‚¹ã‚¿ãƒ³ãƒ—(ãƒŸãƒªç§’)
	"oauth_timestamp" => Time.now.to_i.to_s,
	# ãƒãƒ¼ã‚¸ãƒ§ãƒ³(1.0)
	"oauth_version" => "1.0",
}

# signatureä½œæˆ
oauth_header["oauth_signature"] = signature("GET", 
					consumer_secret, 
					nil, 
					request_token_url, 
					oauth_header)

# GETã™ã‚‹
uri = URI.parse(request_token_url)
proxy_class = Net::HTTP::Proxy(ARGV[0], 8080)
http = proxy_class.new(uri.host)
http.start do |http|
	# oauth_headerã®ãƒ‘ãƒ©ãƒ¡ãƒ¼ã‚¿ã‚’ã‚½ãƒ¼ãƒˆã—ã¦é€£çµ
	param = sort_and_concat(oauth_header)

	res = http.get(uri.path + "?#{param}")

	if res.code == "200" then
		# è¿”ã£ã¦ããŸå€¤ã‚’åˆ†å‰²
		params = res.body.split("&")
		params.each do |param|
			# ã•ã‚‰ã«=ã§åˆ†å‰²ã—å‰éƒ¨åˆ†ã‚’keyã€å¾Œæ–¹éƒ¨åˆ†ã‚’valueã«æ ¼ç´
			key,value = param.split("=")

			# ãƒªã‚¯ã‚¨ã‚¹ãƒˆãƒˆãƒ¼ã‚¯ãƒ³ã‚’æ ¼ç´
			if ("oauth_token" == key) then
				oauth_token = value
			elsif ("oauth_token_secret" == key) then
				oauth_token_secret = value
			end
		end

		# ãƒ—ãƒ­ãƒ³ãƒ—ãƒˆã«PINã‚³ãƒ¼ãƒ‰å–å¾—ç”¨URLè¡¨ç¤º
		print "#{authorize_url}?oauth_token=#{oauth_token}\n"
		print "Input PIN Code. Input...\n"

		# PINã‚³ãƒ¼ãƒ‰å…¥åŠ›å¾…ã¡
		oauth_verifier = STDIN.gets
		# æ”¹è¡Œã‚³ãƒ¼ãƒ‰(\n)å–ã‚Šé™¤ã
		oauth_verifier = oauth_verifier.slice(0, oauth_verifier.length-1)

		# ãƒ˜ãƒƒãƒ€ã«ã‚¢ã‚¯ã‚»ã‚¹ãƒˆãƒ¼ã‚¯ãƒ³ã¨PINã‚³ãƒ¼ãƒ‰è¿½åŠ 
		oauth_header["oauth_token"] = oauth_token
		oauth_header["oauth_verifier"] = oauth_verifier
		
		# ã„ã£ãŸã‚“oauth_signatureå‰Šé™¤
		oauth_header.delete("oauth_signature")

		# å†ã³signatureä½œæˆ
		oauth_header["oauth_signature"] = signature("GET", 
							consumer_secret, 
							oauth_token_secret, 
							access_token_url, 
							oauth_header)

		# oauth_headerã®ãƒ‘ãƒ©ãƒ¡ãƒ¼ã‚¿ã‚’ã‚½ãƒ¼ãƒˆã—ã¦é€£çµ
		param = sort_and_concat(oauth_header)

		# GETã™ã‚‹
		uri = URI.parse(access_token_url)
		proxy_class = Net::HTTP::Proxy(ARGV[0], 8080)
		http = proxy_class.new(uri.host)
		http.start do |http|
			res = http.get(uri.path + "?#{param}")
			if res.code =="200" then
				print "#{res.code}\n"
				print "#{res.body}\n"
			else
				print "ERROR: #{res.code}\n"
			end
		end
	else
		print "ERROR: #{res.code}\n"
	end
end

å‡¦ç†ã®æµã‚Œã¨ã—ã¦ã¯ã€oauth_tokenã‚’è²¼ã‚Šã¤ã‘ãŸhttp://twitter.com/oauth/authorizeã®ã‚¢ãƒ‰ãƒ¬ã‚¹ã‚’å‡ºåŠ›ã™ã‚‹ã®ã§ã€(ãŠæ‰‹æ•°ã§ã™ãŒ)ãƒ–ãƒ©ã‚¦ã‚¶ã‹ã‚‰ã‚¢ã‚¯ã‚»ã‚¹ã—ã¦ã‚‚ã‚‰ã†ã€‚

ãƒ–ãƒ©ã‚¦ã‚¶ã«è¡¨ç¤ºã•ã‚ŒãŸPINã‚³ãƒ¼ãƒ‰ã‚’è²¼ã£ã¤ã‘ã¦ã‚‚ã‚‰ã£ã¦ã€ã“ã‚Œã‚’oauth_verifierã¨ã—ã€ã‚¢ã‚¯ã‚»ã‚¹ãƒˆãƒ¼ã‚¯ãƒ³ã‚’ç™ºè¡Œã—ã¦ã‚‚ã‚‰ã†ã€‚

PINã‚³ãƒ¼ãƒ‰ã®æ‰€ã¯ã„ã¡ã„ã¡ãƒ–ãƒ©ã‚¦ã‚¶ã‹ã‚‰è¡Œã‹ãªã„ã‚ˆã†ã«ã™ã‚‹ã“ã¨ã‚‚ã§ããã†ãªã‚“ã§ã™ãŒâ€¦â€¦ã€‚

*1: ã“ã®æ™‚ã®oauth_tokenã¨oauth_token_secretã¯ä¸€æ™‚çš„ãªã‚‚ã®ã‚‰ã—ã„ã®ã§ã€ã‚¢ã‚¯ã‚»ã‚¹ãƒˆãƒ¼ã‚¯ãƒ³ãŒã‚‚ã‚‰ãˆã‚Œã°å¿˜ã‚Œã¦ã‚‚è‰¯ã„ã‚ˆã†ã§ã™ã€‚

*2: Twitterã«ãƒ­ã‚°ã‚¤ãƒ³ã—ã¦ã„ãªã‘ã‚Œã°ã€ãƒ­ã‚°ã‚¤ãƒ³ç”»é¢ãŒã¾ãšå‡ºãŸã¯ãšã€‚

*3: ãƒªã‚¯ã‚¨ã‚¹ãƒˆãƒˆãƒ¼ã‚¯ãƒ³ã‚’ä½œã‚‹ã¨ãã¯"consumer_secret&"ã§ã—ãŸ

éšåˆ†å‰ã«TwitterãŒãƒ™ãƒ¼ã‚·ãƒƒã‚¯èªè¨¼ã‹ã‚‰OAuthèªè¨¼ã«åˆ‡ã‚Šæ›¿ãˆãŸã¨ã„ã†äº‹ã§ã€‚Java+Wicket+AppEngineã§ãƒ™ãƒ¼ã‚·ãƒƒã‚¯èªè¨¼ã‚’é§†ä½¿ã—ã¦ä½œã£ã¦ã„ãŸTwitterã‚µã‚¤ãƒˆãŒè¦‹ã‚Œãªããªã£ãŸã‚‚ã‚“ã§åˆ‡ã‚Šæ›¿ãˆã¾ã—ãŸã€‚(ç‰¹é›†ï¼šWicketã§å§‹ã‚ã‚‹ã‚ªãƒ–ã‚¸ã‚§ã‚¯ãƒˆæŒ‡å‘ã‚¦ã‚§ãƒ–é–‹ç™ºï½œgihyo.jp â€¦ æŠ€è¡“è©•è«–ç¤¾ ã‚’è¦‹ã¤ã¤)

id:Yoshiori ã•ã‚“ã®ã‚„ã‚‹å¤«ã¨ Python ã§å­¦ã¶ Twitter ã® OAuth - Yoshioriã®Blog ã¨ã€ id:yuroyoro ã•ã‚“ã®OAuthãƒ—ãƒ­ãƒˆã‚³ãƒ«ã®ä¸­èº«ã‚’ã–ã£ãã‚Šè§£èª¬ã—ã¦ã¿ã‚‹ã‚ˆ - ( ê’ªâŒ“ê’ª) ã‚†ã‚‹ã‚ˆã‚æ—¥è¨˜ãŒã¨ã£ã¦ã‚‚è©³ã—ã‹ã£ãŸã®ã§ã€å‚è€ƒã«ã—ã¾ã—ãŸã€‚

å¤§ããªæµã‚Œã¨ã—ã¦ã¯ã€

  1. consumer_keyã¨consumer_secretã‚’ç™ºè¡Œã—ã¦ã‚‚ã‚‰ã†
  2. ãƒªã‚¯ã‚¨ã‚¹ãƒˆãƒˆãƒ¼ã‚¯ãƒ³ã‚’ç™ºè¡Œã—ã¦ã‚‚ã‚‰ã†
  3. ã‚¢ã‚¯ã‚»ã‚¹ãƒˆãƒ¼ã‚¯ãƒ³ã‚’ç™ºè¡Œã—ã¦ã‚‚ã‚‰ã†

ã®3é …ç›®ã€‚ä»Šå›ã¯ãƒªã‚¯ã‚¨ã‚¹ãƒˆãƒˆãƒ¼ã‚¯ãƒ³ã‚’ç™ºè¡Œã—ã¦ã‚‚ã‚‰ã†ã¨ã“ã‚ã¾ã§ã‚„ã‚Šã¾ã™ã€‚

æº–å‚™ Twitterã«ã‚¢ãƒ—ãƒªã‚’ç™»éŒ²ã—ã€consumer_keyã¨consumer_secretã‚’ç™ºè¡Œã—ã¦ã‚‚ã‚‰ã†

  • Twitterã«ãƒ­ã‚°ã‚¤ãƒ³ > è¨­å®š > é€£æºã‚¢ãƒ—ãƒª ã‚’é¸æŠ

  • é–‹ç™ºè€…ã®æ–¹ã¸ > ã“ã¡ã‚‰ ã‚’é¸æŠ

  • ãƒšãƒ¼ã‚¸ä¸‹éƒ¨ã®æ–°ã—ã„ã‚¢ãƒ—ãƒªã‚±ãƒ¼ã‚·ãƒ§ãƒ³ã‚’è¿½åŠ  ã‚’é¸æŠ

å¾Œã§ç·¨é›†ã‚‚ã§ãã‚‹ã®ã§ã¨ã‚Šã‚ãˆãšå…¥åŠ›ã—ã¦ãŠãã€‚ä¸‹è¨˜ã®2é …ç›®ã¯ã¨ã‚Šã‚ãˆãš

    • ã‚¢ãƒ—ãƒªã‚±ãƒ¼ã‚·ãƒ§ãƒ³ã®ç¨®é¡: ã‚¯ãƒ©ã‚¤ã‚¢ãƒ³ãƒˆã‚¢ãƒ—ãƒªã‚±ãƒ¼ã‚·ãƒ§ãƒ³
    • æ¨™æº–ã®ã‚¢ã‚¯ã‚»ã‚¹ã‚¿ã‚¤ãƒ—: Read & Write

ã«ã—ã¦ãŠãã€‚

â€¦â€¦èªè¨¼ã«å¤±æ•—ã—ãŸã¨ãã€ã©ã“ã®ã‚¹ãƒ†ãƒƒãƒ—ã§é–“é•ã£ã¦ã‚‹ã®ã‹ã‚ã‹ã‚‰ãªã‹ã£ãŸã®ã§éå¸¸ã«è‹¦åŠ´ã—ã¾ã—ãŸã€‚å¹¸ã„signatureã‚’ç”Ÿæˆã—ã¦ãã‚Œã‚‹ãƒšãƒ¼ã‚¸ OAuth Signatureç”Ÿæˆã‚µãƒ³ãƒ—ãƒ« ãŒã‚ã‚‹ã®ã§ã€ã“ã“ã§ä½œæˆã—ãŸå€¤ã¨åŒã˜çŠ¶æ³ã‚’ä½œã£ã¦æ¯”è¼ƒã—ã¾ã—ãŸã€‚

ã“ã‚Œã§signã—ã¦ç”Ÿæˆã•ã‚ŒãŸå€¤ã®ã†ã¡ã€signature base stringãŒã€Œèªè¨¼ç”¨ã®å€¤ã‚’ç”Ÿæˆã™ã‚‹ã€ã§ç”Ÿæˆã—ãŸã‹ã£ãŸå€¤ã€‚signatureãŒã€Œã‚­ãƒ¼ã‚’å…ƒã«å€¤ã‚’HMAC-SHA1æ–¹å¼ã§æš—å·åŒ–ã—ãŸå€¤ã‚’base64å½¢å¼ã§ã‚¨ãƒ³ã‚³ãƒ¼ãƒ‰ã™ã‚‹ã€ã§ç”Ÿæˆã—ãŸã‹ã£ãŸå€¤ã¨ãªã£ã¦ã„ã‚‹ã€‚ã‚ã¨ã¯ãŒã‚“ã°ã‚‹ï¼

ã‚½ãƒ¼ã‚¹ã‚³ãƒ¼ãƒ‰

ã‚³ãƒ¼ãƒ‰ã¯ã“ã‚“ãªæ„Ÿã˜ã§â€¦ã‹ãªã‚Šæ³¥è‡­ãå®Ÿè£…ï¼›ã€€åŸºæœ¬çš„ã«ä¸Šã‹ã‚‰ä¸‹ã«æµã‚Œã¦ã„ãã¾ã™ãŒæ–‡å­—åˆ—ã®ã‚¨ã‚¹ã‚±ãƒ¼ãƒ—ã¨oauthãƒ‘ãƒ©ãƒ¡ãƒ¼ã‚¿ã®ä¸¦ã¹æ›¿ãˆã¨çµåˆã¯ä½•å›ã‹ä½¿ã†ã®ã§ãƒ¡ã‚½ãƒƒãƒ‰ã«ã—ã¾ã—ãŸã€‚

require 'openssl'
require 'uri'
require 'net/http'

# æ–‡å­—åˆ—ã®ã‚¨ã‚¹ã‚±ãƒ¼ãƒ—(: / = %ã‚’ã‚¨ã‚¹ã‚±ãƒ¼ãƒ—ã™ã‚‹ã€‚. _ -ã¯ãã®ã¾ã¾)
def escape(value)
	URI.escape(value, Regexp.new("[^a-zA-Z0-9._-]"))
end

# oauth_headerã®æƒ…å ±ã‚’ã‚¢ãƒ«ãƒ•ã‚¡ãƒ™ãƒƒãƒˆé †ã«ä¸¦ã¹æ›¿ãˆ & ã§çµåˆ
def sort_and_concat(oauth_header)
	oauth_header_array = oauth_header.sort
	param = ""
	oauth_header_array.each do |params|
		for i in 1..params.length
			param += params[i-1]
			if i % params.length == 0
				param += "&"
			else
				param += "="
			end
		end
	end
	param = param.slice(0, param.length-1)
end

# ãƒªã‚¯ã‚¨ã‚¹ãƒˆãƒˆãƒ¼ã‚¯ãƒ³å–å¾—ç”¨ã®URL
request_token_url = "http://twitter.com/oauth/request_token"

# Twitterã§ç™»éŒ²ã—ãŸã‚‰ã‚‚ã‚‰ãˆã‚‹
consumer_key = "XXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX"
consumer_secret = "YYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYY"

# oauthãƒ‘ãƒ©ãƒ¡ãƒ¼ã‚¿ãŸã¡
oauth_header = {
	# Consumer Key
	"oauth_consumer_key" => consumer_key,
	# ä¸€æ„ãªå€¤(ä»Šå›ã¯é©å½“ã«å®Ÿè£…)
	"oauth_nonce" => "AAAAAAAA",
	# ç½²åæ–¹å¼(HMAC-SHA1)
	"oauth_signature_method" => "HMAC-SHA1",
	# ãƒªã‚¯ã‚¨ã‚¹ãƒˆç”Ÿæˆæ™‚ã®ã‚¿ã‚¤ãƒ ã‚¹ã‚¿ãƒ³ãƒ—(ãƒŸãƒªç§’)
	"oauth_timestamp" => Time.now.to_i.to_s,
	# ãƒãƒ¼ã‚¸ãƒ§ãƒ³(1.0)
	"oauth_version" => "1.0",
}

# signatureä½œæˆ
# oauth_headerã®ãƒ‘ãƒ©ãƒ¡ãƒ¼ã‚¿ã‚’ã‚½ãƒ¼ãƒˆã—ã¦é€£çµ
param = sort_and_concat(oauth_header)

# ãƒ¡ã‚½ãƒƒãƒ‰ã¨URLã¨ãƒ‘ãƒ©ãƒ¡ãƒ¼ã‚¿ã‚’&ã§é€£çµã™ã‚‹
value = "GET" + "&" + escape(request_token_url) + "&" + escape(param)

# sigunature_keyã®ä½œæˆ
# ãƒªã‚¯ã‚¨ã‚¹ãƒˆãƒˆãƒ¼ã‚¯ãƒ³æ™‚ã¯"CONSUMER_SECRET&"(ã‚¢ãƒ³ãƒ‰ãŒå…¥ã£ã¦ã„ã‚‹)
signature_key = consumer_secret + "&"

# hmac_sha1
sha1 = OpenSSL::HMAC.digest(OpenSSL::Digest::SHA1.new, signature_key, value)
# base64ã‚¨ãƒ³ã‚³ãƒ¼ãƒ‰ signatureã‚’ç”Ÿæˆã§ããŸã®ã§ã€ã“ã‚Œã‚’oauth_signatureã¨ã™ã‚‹
oauth_header["oauth_signature"] = [sha1].pack('m').gsub(/\n/, '')

# GETã™ã‚‹
uri = URI.parse(request_token_url)
proxy_class = Net::HTTP::Proxy(ARGV[0], 8080)
http = proxy_class.new(uri.host)
http.start do |http|
	# oauth_headerã®ãƒ‘ãƒ©ãƒ¡ãƒ¼ã‚¿ã‚’ã‚½ãƒ¼ãƒˆã—ã¦é€£çµ
	param = sort_and_concat(oauth_header)

	res = http.get(uri.path + "?#{param}")

	if res.code == "200" then
		print "#{res.code}\n"
		print "#{res.body}\n"
	else
		print "ERROR: #{res.code}\n"
	end
end
